metadata.title: CVE-2019-13173 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.description: fstream before 1.0.12 is vulnerable to Arbitrary File Overwrite. Extracting tarballs containing a hardlink to a file that already exists in the system, and a file that matches the hardlink, will overwrite the system's file with the contents of the extracted file. The fstream.DirWriter() function is vulnerable. It was discovered that npm/fstream incorrectly handled certain crafted tarballs. An attacker could use this vulnerability to write aritrary files to the filesystem.

notes.note: ebarretto> According to a Github comment, the fix might not be enough.

criterions.comment: node-fstream package in hirsute was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.12-1').
